meanings.definition: To show excessive favoritism towards someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She was overfavoring her youngest son by always giving him extra treats.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was accused of overfavoring certain students in the class.
meanings.sent3: The cat was overfavoring the new toy, completely ignoring its old ones.
meanings.sent4: The politician was overfavoring his own interests, neglecting the needs of the people.
meanings.sent5: The coach's overfavoring of one player led to resentment among the team.

meanings.definition: To give preferential treatment to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The manager was overfavoring his friend by always assigning him the easiest tasks.
meanings.sent2: The company policy strictly prohibits overfavoring any employee based on personal relationships.
meanings.sent3: The overfavoring of the new product caused a decrease in sales for the older ones.
meanings.sent4: Overfavoring one team member can create a sense of unfairness among the rest.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's overfavoring of a particular student was evident to the entire class.

meanings.definition: To be biased in favor of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The judge was accused of overfavoring the prosecution throughout the trial.
meanings.sent2: It is important for a leader to avoid overfavoring any particular group within the organization.
meanings.sent3: The overfavoring of one brand over the others led to a decrease in overall customer satisfaction.
meanings.sent4: Overfavoring a specific candidate can undermine the credibility of the entire selection process.
meanings.sent5: The coach's overfavoring of star players often resulted in the team's overall performance suffering.
